_header: O merciful Jesu for merci to Thee I cry
Subjects: prayers, for use in church; prayers, to Christ; Christ, prayers to
_description: A prayer to Jesus for mercy, said at the Levacion — twelve irregular lines

Lam559.First Lines:
O merciful ihesu for merci to thei crie swete ihesu haue merci on
                    me…
Lam559.Last Lines:
…Lord ihesu graunt me my bonethat I may haue good grace and
                    fortuneheir in this worldthat I may here so for to dothat it may
                    be plesinge to the ihesuand sauacioun to my soule AmenIn the wurschip
                    of god and of oure swete ladiand all holi compani of hevyn and
                    inforȝeuenes of mi misdedePater noster
Lam559.Attributed Title:
This praer here folwyng schold be saud bifore the leuacioun dewouteli
                    knelyng (f. 24v, rubric)
Lam559.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Levation Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         40 (1942): 131-46: 136.
